contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Akune |JapaneseName= 阿久根市 |MapImage= Akune in Kagoshima Prefecture.png |Region= [[Kyūshū]] |Prefecture= [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]] |District= |Area_km2= 134.30 |PopDate= April 2008 |Population= 23,887 |Density_km2= 178 |Coords= |LatitudeDegrees= 32 |LatitudeMinutes= 1 |LatitudeSeconds= |LongtitudeDegrees= 130 |LongtitudeMinutes= 13 |LongtitudeSeconds= |Tree= [[Pomelo]] |Flower= Tsuwabuki <small>([[Asteraceae]] farfugium japonicum)</small> |SymbolImage= Flag of Akune, Kagoshima.png |SymbolDescription= Flag |Mayor= Yoshimasa Nishihira (since January 2011) |CityHallPostalCode= 899-1696 |CityHallAddress=200 Tsurumichō, Akune-shi, Kagoshima-ken |CityHallPhone= 0996-73-1211 |CityHallLink= [http://www.city.akune.kagoshima.jp/index.html Akune City] }} {{nihongo|'''Akune'''|阿久根市|Akune-shi}} is a [[cities of Japan|city]] located in [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. As of 2008, the city has an estimated [[population]] of 23,887 and the [[population density|density]] of 178 persons per km². The total area is 134.30 km². The city was founded on April 1, 1952. == Climate == Akune has a [[humid subtropical climate]] ([[Köppen climate classification]] ''Cfa'') with hot summers and mild winters. Precipitation is significant throughout the year, and is heavier in summer, especially the months of June and July. <div style="width:70%;"> {{Weather box |location = Akune |single line = Y |metric
